message_1: Suppose you have a linear logic system with two premises: p⊗q and p⊸r. Give an example of an implication that can be derived from this system.
message_2:
An example of an implication that can be derived from this linear logic system is q⊸r. 

Here's the reasoning:

1. p⊗q (premise)
2. p⊸r (premise)
3. q (from 1, using the ⊗ elimination rule)
4. p (from 1, using the ⊗ elimination rule)
5. r (from 2 and 4, using the ⊸ elimination rule)
6. q⊸r (from 3 and 5, using the ⊸ introduction rule)
